courseTitle: Canva Essentials: From Zero to Hero
summary: Master the fundamentals of Canva to create stunning graphics for web and mobile. This course will take you from a complete beginner to a confident designer, ready to tackle any creative project.

lessons.title: Introduction to Canva's Interface
lessons.content:
Welcome to Canva!

Canva is a powerful and user-friendly design tool that empowers anyone to create beautiful graphics. When you first open Canva, you'll see the main dashboard. Let's break down the key areas:

  • Top Navigation Bar: This is where you can find templates, features, and learning resources.
  • Side Panel: Your hub for accessing your projects, brand kits, and content planner.
  • Main Workspace: The central area where you'll find design suggestions and can start a new design using the 'Create a design' button.

The editor itself is where the magic happens. It consists of the side object panel (for adding elements, text, photos, etc.), the top toolbar (for editing selected objects), and the canvas where you build your design.
lessons.task: Spend 5 minutes exploring the Canva dashboard. Click on at least three different template categories and open the editor for a 'Facebook Post' to get a feel for the workspace.

lessons.title: Basic Tools: Shapes, Text, and Colors
lessons.content:
The Building Blocks of Design

Every great design starts with the basics. In Canva, you can easily add and manipulate core elements.

  • Shapes: Find them under the 'Elements' tab. You can search for specific shapes like 'circle' or 'arrow'. Once added, you can resize, rotate, and change their color using the top toolbar.
  • Text: Click the 'Text' tab to add headings, subheadings, or body text. Canva also offers stylish font combinations to get you started.
  • Colors: Select any element and click the color swatch in the top toolbar. You can choose from document colors, brand colors, or pick a new one from the color picker. You can even use a HEX code for a specific color.
lessons.task: Create a new design. Add a square, a circle, and a triangle. Give each shape a different color. Then, add a heading with your name and change its font and color.

options: On the main dashboard and in the 'Templates' tab

questions.correctAnswer: On the main dashboard and in the 'Templates' tab
questions.explanation: Canva provides a massive library of templates accessible directly from the dashboard or the dedicated 'Templates' section to help you start designing quickly.

questions.question: What is the shortcut to duplicate an element in Canva?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + D (or Cmd + D on Mac) is the quickest way to duplicate any selected element or group of elements on your canvas.

questions.question: Which panel in the Canva editor is used for adding new photos, text, and other elements to your design?
questions.explanation: The panel on the left side of the editor is your primary resource for adding all types of new content to your design canvas.

modules.title: Module 2: Working with Media and Layouts

lessons.title: Uploading and Editing Photos
lessons.content:
Bringing Your Designs to Life

Canva makes it easy to work with images. You can use Canva's vast stock photo library or upload your own.

  • Uploading: Go to the 'Uploads' tab and drag-and-drop your files or use the 'Upload files' button.
  • Editing: Once an image is on your canvas, select it to open the 'Edit Photo' options in the top toolbar. Here you can adjust brightness, contrast, and saturation, apply filters, or use AI-powered tools like the 'Background Remover' (Pro feature).
  • Frames & Grids: Drag your photos into 'Frames' or 'Grids' (found in the 'Elements' tab) to automatically crop them into specific shapes or layouts.
lessons.task: Upload a personal photo. Apply a filter to it. Then, find a 'Frame' (e.g., a circle or a Polaroid frame) and drag your photo into it.

lessons.title: Arranging Elements: Position, Layers, and Alignment
lessons.content:
Creating Order from Chaos

Professional designs rely on good alignment and layering. Canva gives you the tools to organize your elements precisely.

  • Position Tab: With an element selected, click 'Position' in the top toolbar. Here you can align it to the page (e.g., center, middle) or to other elements.
  • Layers: The 'Position' tab also has a 'Layers' view. You can drag layers up or down to change their stacking order (bring to front, send to back).
  • Grouping: Hold the 'Shift' key and click multiple elements to select them all. Then, click 'Group' in the top toolbar. Now you can move and resize them as a single unit.
lessons.task: Create three overlapping squares of different colors. Use the 'Position' tab to send the middle square to the back. Then, select all three squares and group them together.

questions.question: Which tool allows you to automatically crop a photo into a specific shape?
questions.explanation: Frames, found in the 'Elements' tab, act as placeholders that you can drag your images into to automatically crop them to the frame's shape.

questions.question: If you want to move an object behind another object, which option should you use?
questions.explanation: The 'Layers' panel, found within the 'Position' options, allows you to control the stacking order of elements on your canvas.
